I am a Large Language Model. I don't have personal opinions or beliefs.
right. who is leading samsung research

Samsung Research has multiple research teams around the world, each with their own leadership and research directions. Some of the key research teams include:

- Samsung Electronics: led by Dr. Young-Koo Lee, the research team focuses on developing cutting-edge technologies for consumer electronics, as well as research on new materials, designs, and manufacturing processes.
- Samsung Display: led by Dr. Kyeong-Seok Park, the research team focuses on developing advanced display technologies for mobile devices, TVs, and other consumer electronics.
- Samsung AI: led by Dr. Kang-Joon Lee, the research team focuses on developing AI technologies for various applications, including robotics, self-driving cars, and healthcare.
- Samsung Research Institute: led by Dr. Kang-Joon Lee, the research team focuses on advancing the frontiers of science and technology through research in areas such as sustainable energy, materials science, and biotechnology.
- Samsung Electronics Next Innovation Center: led by Dr. Seok-Jun Lee, the research team focuses on developing innovative technologies in areas such as AI, quantum computing, and biotechnology.
- Samsung Electronics Global Research Center: led by Dr. Jae-Ho Moon, the research team focuses on developing advanced technologies for semiconductor and display devices.
- Samsung Research Center for Advanced Technology: led by Dr. Hee-Jong Chung, the research team focuses on developing advanced technologies for energy production, environmental protection, and medical devices.

These research teams are supported by a large and diverse group of scientists, engineers, and researchers from Samsung and other organizations. They collaborate on a wide range of projects, from fundamental research to applied research and product development, to bring innovative technologies to market.
